message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public static void main(String args[]){
    Scanner sc=new Scanner(System.in);
    System.out.println("Enter the String");
    String str=sc.nextLine();
    System.out.println("Enter the StringMode");
    int mode = sc.nextInt();
    int count = 0;
    
    switch(mode){
        case 0:
            for(int i=0; i<str.length(); i++){
                if(str.charAt(i) == ' '){
                    count++;
                }
            }
            System.out.println("Total number of white spaces: " + count);
            break;
        case 1:
            // Remove white space from the beginning of the string
            String trimmedStr1 = str.replaceAll("^\\s+", "");
            System.out.println(trimmedStr1);
            break;
        case 2:
            // Remove white space from the end of the string
            String trimmedStr2 = str.replaceAll("\\s+$", "");
            System.out.println(trimmedStr2);
            break;
        default:
            System.out.println("Invalid mode");
            break;
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The code prompts the user to enter a string and a mode. Based on the mode, it either counts the total number of white spaces in the string (mode 0), removes white space from the beginning of the string (mode 1), or removes white space from the end of the string (mode 2). The code uses a for loop to iterate through each character in the string and checks if it is a white space. If it is, the count variable is incremented. The code uses the replaceAll() method to remove white space from the beginning or end of the string.
